content.webTitle: Frank Farina: I am not a 'clueless' coach at Sydney FC

fields.headline: Frank Farina: I am not a 'clueless' coach at Sydney FC
fields.bodyText: Frank Farina has denied he lacks a clear plan to bring Sydney FC forward, following fierce criticism from fans. Banners were unfurled calling for Farina to be sacked during Sydney’s defeat to Adelaide last weekend, and the coach had a drink thrown at him by a fan. The players’ union has also warned of legal action after two senior players were excluded from training with the rest of the squad. However, in a blogpost titled ‘What I’m Thinking’, Farina cited a football career in which he “won four championships in two countries … and coached around 275 games” in response to criticism over his leadership at Sydney. “You might disagree with what I do, but one thing I’m not is ‘clueless’ when it comes to football,” Farina wrote. “I’m happy to talk about what we’re trying to do – not that anyone has actually asked.” Farina also responded to criticism of the management structure at the club. “I’ve worked in many clubs and environments in football, and Sydney FC is one of the more professional organisations I’ve experienced,” he wrote.
